newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian metals prices firm on low demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian metals prices firm on low demand.

text.p: Indian base metals were steady on low industrial demand and narrow trade on Wednesday, traders said.
They said nickel was steady at 39,500 rupees per quintal on stray physical support, after falling by 400 rupees on Tuesday.
Copper was unchanged at 12,300 rupees, so was zinc at 6,300 rupees and lead at 4,900 rupees, respectively. Aluminium was steady at 7,450 rupees on nominal trade.
The markets are closed on Thursday for a local holiday and will reopen on Friday.
